attributes.action: stop introducing headline grabbing new laws when perfectly good legislation already exists
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The current Government seems obsessed with new headline grabbing laws that either can't be enforced (e.g. child car seats) or won't be enforced (e.g. mobile phone usage by drivers).

These problems should be dealt with by a mixture of education and enforcement of existing legislation (an unpoliced law is simply a collection of words on a piece of paper). New legislation should only be used as a last resort, so as to avoid an overly complicated legal system.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
